description: Finally i was able to finish my 4-panel mosaic project of the heart nebula. After lots of interruptions due to bad weather i collected enough OIII data to work with. To be honest OIII data is horrible and it seems like every non cloudy night is around full moon. To counter-attack the mediocre quality of the OIII data i downscaled the image using IntegerResample in PixInsight with a resample factor of 2. It's worth mentioning that this was orginally planned as a true 2x2 panel mosaic but in the end i added data of two other images as well. So in total the following data went into this image: Ha Panels: - 4x 100x180s; Darks: 100, Flats: 50, Flat Darks: 50 - 1x 150x180s; Darks: 100, Flats: 50, Flat Darks: 50 (data from this image) - 1x 135x120s; Darks: 50, Flats: 40, Bias: 200 (data from this image) OIII Panels: - 4x 100x180s; Darks: 100, Flats: 50, Flat Darks: 50 - 1x 135x180s; Darks: 100, Flats: 50, Flat Darks: 50 (data from this image) - 1x 121x120s; Darks: 50, Flats: 40, Bias: 200 (data from this image) Total integration time: ~62 hours Looking at the final image and the huge amount of integration time that went into it i'm a bit disappointed. But i mainly blame the OIII data and my limited processing skills for that. :-)
title: IC 1805 - Heart Nebula & NGC 896 - Fishhead Nebula, Mosaic [Bicolor]
